sections.heading: Honorific Prefixes お and ご
sections.content:
お (o) and ご (go) are honorific prefixes added to nouns, verbs, and adjectives to show respect or politeness. お is used with native Japanese words (wago), while ご is typically used with Chinese-origin words (kango). These prefixes beautify language and show consideration.

名前 → お名前 "name" (polite) 住所 → ご住所 "address" (polite) 茶 → お茶 "tea" (polite)

children.heading: お for native Japanese words
children.content: お金 "money" お水 "water" お茶 "tea" お米 "rice" お酒 "alcohol" Japanese-origin words kun-reading

children.heading: ご for Chinese-origin words
children.content: ご住所 "address" ご家族 "family" ご意見 "opinion" ご質問 "question" ご説明 "explanation" Chinese-origin words on-reading

children.heading: Daily items
children.content: お金 "money" お水 "water" お茶 "tea" お米 "rice" お箸 "chopsticks" お皿 "plate" お椀 "bowl" Everyday polite words

children.heading: Body and personal
children.content: お名前 "name" お体 "body/health" お顔 "face" お手 "hand" お腹 "stomach" Personal items

children.heading: Time and occasions
children.content: お正月 "New Year" お誕生日 "birthday" お休み "holiday/rest" お昼 "lunch/noon" お時間 "time" Time-related

children.heading: Information
children.content: ご住所 "address" ご連絡 "contact" ご意見 "opinion" ご質問 "question" ご説明 "explanation" ご報告 "report" Formal information

children.heading: Family and people
children.content: ご家族 "family" ご両親 "parents" ご主人 "husband" ご結婚 "marriage" Family terms

children.heading: Abstract concepts
children.content: ご心配 "worry" ご安心 "relief" ご了承 "understanding" ご協力 "cooperation" Abstract nouns

children.heading: お + Verb Stem + する (humble)
children.content: お送りする "send" お持ちする "carry" お待ちする "wait" お聞きする "ask" Your action for superior Humble form

children.heading: お + Verb Stem + になる (respectful)
children.content: お読みになる "read" お書きになる "write" お帰りになる "return" お待ちになる "wait" Superior's action Respectful form

children.heading: お + Verb Stem + ください
children.content: お待ちください "please wait" お座りください "please sit" お入りください "please come in" お読みください "please read" Polite requests

children.heading: Not always honorific
children.content: お茶 "tea" (standard, not honorific) お米 "rice" (standard) お金 "money" (standard) お風呂 "bath" (standard) Fixed expressions General politeness

children.heading: Feminine speech
children.content: Women tend to use more: お野菜 "vegetables" お料理 "cooking" おトイレ "toilet" Softens speech More common for women

children.heading: Your own possessions
children.content: Unnatural: 私のご家族 ⚠️ Natural: 私の家族 ✓ "My family" Don't elevate your own Exception: fixed expressions

children.heading: Already polite words
children.content: Don't add: 先生 (already respectful) Wrong: お先生 ⚠️ Inherently respectful words No prefix needed

children.heading: Foreign loanwords
children.content: Usually no prefix: コーヒー "coffee" (no お) パン "bread" (no お) Exception: some fixed words おビール "beer" (casual, feminine)

children.heading: お + i-adjective stem
children.content: 忙しい → お忙しい "busy" 若い → お若い "young" 元気 → お元気 "healthy/energetic" お忙しいところ... "When you're busy..." Respectful description

children.heading: Common set phrases
children.content: お疲れ様です "thank you for your work" お世話になります "thank you for your help" お大事に "take care" お待たせしました "sorry to keep you waiting" お願いします "please" お邪魔します "excuse me for intruding" Fixed polite expressions

children.heading: Professional terms
children.content: お名刺 "business card" ご確認 "confirmation" ご検討 "consideration" ご提案 "proposal" お見積もり "estimate" Business vocabulary

children.heading: Words that take お (Chinese origin)
children.content: お電話 "telephone" お勉強 "study" お料理 "cooking" Exceptions to the rule Common usage

children.heading: Words that never take prefix
children.content: No prefix: 会社 "company" (not お会社) 学校 "school" (not お学校) 病院 "hospital" (not お病院) Institutional words

children.heading: Kansai dialect
children.content: More お usage: おいしい → おいしい (standard) おもしろい → おもろい (Kansai) Regional variation

children.heading: Other's possessions
children.content: お名前 "your name" ご家族 "your family" お車 "your car" ご住所 "your address" Their belongings Shows respect

children.heading: Wrong prefix choice
children.content: Wrong: お住所 ⚠️ Correct: ご住所 ✓ "Address" Chinese origin = ご

children.heading: Over-using prefixes
children.content: Unnatural: お私のお家 ⚠️ Natural: 私の家 ✓ "My house" Don't overdo it

children.heading: With own things (except fixed)
children.content: Wrong: 私のお名前 ⚠️ Correct: 私の名前 ✓ "My name" Your own = no prefix

children.heading: Quick test
children.content: Native Japanese reading? → お お茶 (cha - kun-reading) Chinese reading? → ご ご家族 (kazoku - on-reading) Listen to the reading

children.heading: Basic
children.content: お名前をお願いします。 "Your name, please." ご質問がありますか。 "Do you have questions?" お茶をどうぞ。 "Please have tea." ご住所をお聞きしてもよろしいですか。 "May I ask your address?" お疲れ様です。 "Thank you for your work."

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: お忙しいところ申し訳ございませんが、 少々お時間をいただけますでしょうか。 ご相談したいことがございます。 "I'm sorry to bother you when you're busy, but could I have a moment of your time? There's something I'd like to consult about." 本日はご来店いただき、 ありがとうございます。お名前と ご連絡先をお伺いしてもよろしいですか。 "Thank you for visiting our store today. May I ask your name and contact information?" ご注文の商品をお届けに 参りました。お時間は 大丈夫でしょうか。 "I've come to deliver your ordered product. Is the time convenient?"
